comment._content: looks like German soldiers on the left, so probably taken between 1914 and 1918 Found in a search.

comment.author: 43641432@N00
comment._content:
The Anspach fountain erected 1897 is still located at southern part of the place (was moved later to the center of the Place, and still went to another location in 1979.).  The tramways rails are visible near the soldiers. The Continental hotel behind the monument was renovated in 1961. Actually before the canailsation of the Senne River, there was a Church (Eglise des Augustines) demolished   for those works when the Place de Brouckère was constructed.  ph@live.com.mx
.

comment.author: 43641432@N00
comment._content: i have somewhere  a reproduction of a picture with the building behind the Continental hotel still in construction process, probably before the Anspach monument was erected.
